question: Can I refinance my mortgage to reduce my monthly payments, given a current rate of 4%?
true_answer: Yes, refinancing can reduce payments if new rate is lower than 4% and fees are justified.

steps.content: Can I refinance my mortgage to reduce my monthly payments, given a current rate of 4%?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent to explore refinance options. 2) Involve credit_agent for credit impact. 3) Use calculator for payment estimation. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Retrieving knowledge on current mortgage refinance rates.
Current refinance rates are around 3.5% depending on credit score.
Checking impact of refinancing on credit score.
Refinancing may cause a temporary drop in credit score due to hard inquiry.
Calculating potential new monthly payments with a 3.5% rate.
New monthly payment estimated to be $150 less than current payments.
Are there any fees involved in refinancing?
Refinancing typically involves fees of 2-5% of the loan amount.
Review complete, all calculations and information verified.
Yes, refinancing can reduce payments if new rate is lower than 4% and fees are justified.
